answers.answer: I had that a few days ago... It would be because of wrong sleeping position the previous night.. As long as the baby is active, i don't think it matters..

Was there protein in your urine at your last check? Have you gained several pounds over the last couple if days? You don't actually need high blood pressure to be at risk for preeclampsia. Not to scare you, but I would just call your doctor and see what they say. Sudden swelling of hands, feet, and face can be dangerous.

question: So I'm 37+4 and I am getting numbness in my legs my swelling in my feet hands and face are unbelievable I don't have high blood pressure...I'm trying to figure out why my legs go numb anybody else going through this????
title: numbness!!!!!
